p: To analyze the antimicrobial effect of essential oil of T. pulegioides α-TA chemotype and pure α-TA the broth microdilution method was employed and the minimum inhibitory concentrations (MICs) against the selected microorganisms were determined. The growth inhibition of investigated bacteria by α-TA essential oil was weak compare to other microorganisms and antibiotics vancomycin and gentamicin which were used as controls. The analysis showed that pure α-TA demonstrated effect on Gram-positive bacterium S. aureus but was not effective on Gram-negative bacterium E. coli. Recently, it was shown that essential oil of Elettaria cardamomum, in which major components are α-terpinyl acetate (47.5%), demonstrated effectiveness against Gram-positive bacteria ranked 0.125 to 1 mg/mL [ 63]. Thymus algeriensis essential oil (α-terpinyl acetate 47.4%) showed antimicrobial activity against the Gram-positive bacteria [ 64].
